Reviews.Title: “Good and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mynthon Posted by an Oktogo.ru traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. There is nearby a X9 bus stop to the airport and U-bahn. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was in a double clean and comfortable room. I was check-in at 9 am without problem. WI-FI worked well. The lobby has a computer with free internet. I was quite pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: WWLL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Econtel, Berlin for three days in December 2011. I chose Econtel because 1. It appeared to be good value; 2. It is right at the Airport Bus X9 stop and a subway stop is only 200 meters away; 3. Internet is included. I was very satisfied with my stay. The staff is efficient and helpful. The room was not fancy but everything was clean and in working condition. There is a supermarket in an adjacent building. That was very useful as the restaurant and restaurants nearby are not open on Sundays. Econtel is in a residential neighborhood and other restaurants are some 10 minutes walk away. The internet was fast and reliable. My only discomfort was that the heat was barely warm enough during my stay which included a period of hail. Although breakfast was 13 euros I had it all three days. I thought it was tasty and good value. I had dinner in the Econtel restaurant the first night because I had flown from the US west coast. I had the currywurst dinner which included a beer for about 9 euros. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jess79uk
Reviews.Content: I had a comfortable stay at Econtel hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located just 10 minutes from the city centre (by bus). Rooms were clean and breakfast was of a good choice! The only negative thing which I will mention is the glass door to the bathroom. This was a little weird as I shared with a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Very professional and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rada0112
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good especially if you are coming from the airport Tegel. Public transport works great, from the airport to the hotel in less than 10 minutes. Bus route from the hotel to the city center are also good. Near the hotel is a beautiful castle Charlottenburg, and also the peaceful promenade along the river. I was in a single clean, comfortable and cozy room. The toilet is a relatively small but obvious renovated and clean. The bed was comfortable, and also a sofa. Writing desk is large enough to accommodate a laptop, papers, a cup of coffee and other small items. All rooms have free internet connection. Breakfast is buffet style, with a large selection of cheese and ham. However, staff is the best in the hotel. These are young people who are extremely professional, pleasant and smiling in the most positive sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great buffet breakast, great location... except”
Reviews.Author: WowMe_1097
Reviews.Content: ... except on my last stay, 27th, April, 2011 - 1st, May, 2011 I was not treated with very much respect. Before I get into the details I want to share with all who might be thinking of staying at the Econtel in Berlin. The hotel is located in a great location next to bus lines and a few minuets walking distance to the Charlottenburg palace and its beautiful garden and safe biking paths (the hotel rent bikes at a great price, 7.50 euro for one whole day) and not to mention the hotel's incredibly yummy buffet breakfast... heavenly! The rooms are a bit small but I don't go to Europe to stay in hotel rooms all day. Here's my only small gripe. All the receptionist working at the front desk. It saddens me deeply to say ANYTHING bad about the hotel, for I have stayed with them on 4 different other occasions when I had vacationed in the beautiful city of Berlin. I'm not what you might call an overly sensitive person but when I see people giggling for what seems to be for no apparent reason I worry my fly might be unzipped, or maybe I have my baseball cap turned sideways on my head. I noticed these fits of giggling on 3 occasions throughout my stay at the hotel. I felt offended. I can't recall wearing a clown nose or oversize large red floppy shoes. If this is what made all the receptionist chuckle I can appreciate this but I wasn't wearing any such items on my person. Maybe I am way too overly sensitive, or, maybe I should have asked them what the bloody hel* they were all laughing at?! I felt like Rodney Dangerfield. Anyway. I absolutely love Econtel Hotel Berlin, I highly recommend anyone to stay there. Anyone who isn't bothered by random outburst of giggling from well-dressed unprofessional desk clerks. Important note; In all my stays at the hotel this was the only time I was slightly annoyed with the new faces who are now working at the Econtel Hotel Berlin behind the reception counter.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so...”
Reviews.Author: Nearykourouysrolanh
Reviews.Content: That's is my second time staying here but they don't care wether return guests or not and they just treated guest as normally. Staffs are not really friendly and helpful. My room key was very hard to close or open , I told them to check but it was still the same. The main bulb in my room and my boss's room were not functioned and I asked them to change but no one take action for the entire stay for 6 nights. The noise from outside can be heard into the room and pretty noisy to hear some one walking a long corridor. I will not choose this hotel again for my next business trip to Berlin ....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but really small- felt like I was in a Youth Hostel instead of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpotTVMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after using the German Train station travel agent. He suggested this hotel telling us it was a 3 star location. It was far from 3 stars in my book. I will say it was clean and the staff was very friendly. The room was crazy small and not at all suited for small kids with 2 beds being bunk beds. All were twin size. The pillows were flat and lumpy. The bathroom was like being in an RV. We are not large people and my shoulders bumped the walls while in the loo and shower... The rails on the bunks were cardboard like wood- not very safe for a 5 year old to sleep in. We asked for a larger room but they said they could not help. We had a tough time getting the TV to work. When it did decide to turn on we couldn't really see it because the bunk bed blocked the view. The breakfast was very good. It seemed fresh with lots of choices and the staff was nice in the restaurant and at the front desk. My reason's for the low marks are the size of room- lumpy beds and pillows. It was also very cold. It seemed as though the heat cut off after 7pm. We had our heat turned up to the max and still were chilly. There were a few ethnic type restaurants nearby and it was very close to the bus/train stop. I found this part of Berlin to be a bit dirty and run down compared with other parts of town that we saw. Lots of litter/broken glass ect. If you are looking for clean and cheap this is for you. If you are looking for a 3 star hotel....HA!! it's NOT! The photos posted on this site are exactly what our room looked like. Not at all like the official photos of their rooms. I will say that the rest of the hotel did look like the photos just not our room LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Farandout
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and was very happy with my choice. We got a room overlooking the back lot which was okay because it was quiet. There's a large grocery store in the same block which is very convenient. Bus stops and underground stations are near, so that's covered also. The neighborhood is quiet and if you don't mind staying out of the city center this just might be the place for you. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but without airconditioning!”
Reviews.Author: Jb-tb
Reviews.Content: We spend a couple of days in this hotel during the summer of 2010 to visit Berlin. The hotel is located in a quiet, friendly area and it is very close to the subway station Mierendorffplatz. From there, you can easily explore the Western part of the city, or take the subway to Charlottenburg where you can take the S-Bahn to other important parts of Berlin.The staff and service was very friendly, they even offered us a bussiness room allthough we only paid for a regular tourist room. The breakfast was outstanding, like most of the times in German hotels. The rooms were ok and clean, but a bit on the small side. There was hardly enough space to put the suitcase on the floor and the shower was pretty cramped too. The biggest issue with this hotel is the lack of airconditioning; this can become problematic during the hot summer months. Luckily, our window was on the backside of the hotel, so we could open it during the night and we didnt hear any traffic at all. Overall, a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “A bit loud--but otherwise very comfortable and a good first hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BioPsyc1118
Reviews.Content: Last summer I went on a trip with a program at my University (I am a college student), and we stayed here our first two nights. It was not my first time in the European countries so I was accustomed to how lodging is different than in American hotels. While some, shall we say less-traveled people found the rooms a bit on the small side, I thought that by European standards, the rooms were fairly spacious and comfortable. Being a part of a tour group meant that we were not in the hotel very much, nonetheless it was comfortable enough for me to get sleep after 36 hours of being awake (I don't sleep on planes!) The only real complaint I had was the street traffic noise. As this was not in a completely busy neighborhood, I wasn't expecting the noise to be that loud. However, when you were as tired as we were by the end of the day, it didn't bother you THAT much. Other than that this hotel was very good! I felt that the staff was very helpful and most of them spoke English very well. The breakfast was spectacular and much more than other European breakfasts I have had! I also enjoyed the convenience of the hotel. It was only a block or two from the Mierendorfplatz metro station and was very close to the "busy" area of Berlin! Also it was convenient to have a ReWe right next to the hotel in case any water or snacks were needed. Overall a wonderful stay though!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and simple”
Reviews.Author: Katch73
Reviews.Content: What do you want from a hotel when on a city trip? A good bed, good breakfast and easy travel options into the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for its location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JennSingapore
Reviews.Content: The staff was hot and cold. One girl was extremely friendly and helpful -- I'm glad I spoke to her when I asked about recommendations! The other front desk people were not so friendly and didn't seem to really understand English, but pretended to anyway -- which caused a lot of confusion! The room was clean enough. I was glad I read the reviews on TripAdvisor, because I almost demanded a large bed, but when I was told it meant an additional charge, I settled for what I had. (Booking online can be confusing -- the regular room has 2 single beds, they claim one of these is a sofa bed, but really it's the same single size bed. Great for travel with friends. Good value considering its location in Berlin. It was a 10 min bus ride to the Zoo Hbf, which is one of the busiest hbf in Germany. There was free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ParrotSue
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, fair price and excellent breakfast buffet. Rooms were clean, the price was a bit more than advertised in guide book, but the Berlin Marathon was being held and all the hotels in Berlin were out to make a buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: pascalpierre
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights while in Berlin. Nice place with a HUGE breakfast buffet!!!!! Very friendly staff and clean room. Garage cost 5,- € per day and seems safe but Berlin is a safe city so I guess I could have parked outside the Hotel as well. The U-Bahn is only a couiple of meters away and takes you in the heart of the city ( need to change at Bismarkplatz). nothing to complain about eventhough they charge you 2,- € for the 0.75L bottle of water in the room...But that's OK. I would certainly stay at this hotel next time because it's really easy to find and next to Charlotenburg. there are a couiple of eateries as well in the area. That helps.

Reviews.Title: “Econtel Berlin - For tour groups only”
Reviews.Author: travel_aus058
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Cosmos tour of Central Europe. This hotel was fine for a two night stay. The location of the hotel was fine, there was a supermarket next door, public transport was close and took you straight into central Berlin and the hotel was located close to the Charlotte Palace. From what I could tell this hotel caters mainly to tour groups. There were students staying at the hotel and we were in rooms with fixed twin beds. The room itself was reasonably comfortable despite the fact we could not join the beds. The blinds did not block out external light which was a bit annoying. The telephones did not work and the bathroom was not as clean as we would have liked. The breakfast was fine, although very busy with all the tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recomend”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieBEngland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Berlin traveling with 12 girlfriends and we stayed at The Econtel Berlin. We had a fantastic time and found the hotel to be very clean and ideal for our needs. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable but the glass bathroom doors caused much amusement within our group! The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times, including the bar staff who were very patient with us and our numerous requests for "swimming pool" cocktails! Check them out if you go. The Hotel is conveniently situated for getting out and about with a bus stop right outside running very regularly into the city centre. My only complaint if any is the fact that there is no outside area to sit and enjoy their tasty cocktails! But there is a park about two minutes walk away.There are plenty of bars and restaurants all within an easy walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Berlin traveling with a group or a small party. We all had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, reasonably connected”
Reviews.Author: Rifleman_82
Reviews.Content: Despite some other reviews, we found this hotel reasonably connected. The X9 bus (at the bus stop just outside) gets you to the Berlin Zoo in 10 minutes. For those not familiar with Berlin, the Zoo station is a major transportation hub, being a bus terminus. The U- and S-Bahn stations are here too. Apart from that, the Mierendorfplatz U-Bahn station is down the street (200 m), and brings you to Schoenefeld airport with one change at Rudow. The hotel rooms are clean, the staff are friendly, and that's what matters to us. WiFi is available for free. No complaints on any other aspect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Between 20-40 minutes drive to center”
Reviews.Author: Speukes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located in the center, it takes approx. 20 minutes U-Bahn to reach the closest tourist attractions, and 45 minutes to reach Alexanderplatz. If you don't mind this, you have found yourself a good hotel. The neighbourhood itself is quiet and safe. Although we had no hotel-shampoo or shower gel (must be the first time ever), everything else you need will probably be there, including free wireless internet and a good breakfast buffet. There's a big supermarket right next to the hotel, and (as like in the rest of Berlin) finding something to eat won't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “In a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: UKJohnH
Reviews.Content: Wrong location, nothing around, U-Bahn station is close enough, but its on a line that requires changes to get in to the centre. Comfort rooms seemed pretty basic but the hotel brekky was very good with plenty of choice. I wouldn't stay again because of the location, it is not central to anything.

Reviews.Title: “best for exhiition visitors”
Reviews.Author: saur
Reviews.Content: since 1998 I stay alltime for the ITB in the hotel. the nearby location to the fairground and the service brings me back even 2007. Service, food and a warm welcome make the time as exhibitor comfortable. Best location for some nice restaurants and if you have time to visit the castle of Charlottenburg. Direct bus from Tegel airport or train station Zoologischer Garten. Car park on the street or garage.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: unclechuckle
Reviews.Content: booked late for a stay during the IFA show in early September which is why prices were probably a lot a higher than normal. Nothing wrong with this place but just wouldn't pay 150 euros for these rooms. as far as I'm aware Berlin isn't an overly expensive place so would estimate that this hotel should cost about 60-80 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Best Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Froggy1313
Reviews.Content: We stayed and were very pleasantly surprised. Family room included 2 sets of bunkbeds, and small desk with Mickey Mouse motif, freshly decorated. It was quiet, clean, and a great place to stay. Internet access in the lobby, elevator, and restaurant. Breakfast not included for us, but juice and coffee, etc. were free and available. Front Desk staff were friendly, and helpful, with 24 hour service. Bus stop across the street which is on the bus line to the zoo - you can get anywhere from there. Nice residential neighborhool. I lived in Berlin for 3 years, and this was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: dancer62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter and booked the Easter package. A bit disappointing as the room was supposed to be the comfort class, but didn´t seem any bigger/better than the normal rooms, except the twin beds were next to each other. Tiny (1.4m by 1.8m, honest) bathroom. Tip: to sit comfortably on the toilet, push the shower door inwards..... The included 3 course meal was no choice, although we managed to persuade the waiter to let us have a salad instead of the soup. Food average. Free parking on the street a big bonus. No problems. Hotel is used by tour groups, so breakfast can be a bit hectic. At Euro 308 for 2 people for 3 nights incl. one dinner (drinks excl) & breakfast just about OK on value.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, good room, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay of 4 nights. Big room with king size bed. Free wi-access was a great bonus for us on extended travel. Very clean. Free safe in room which fitted our laptop. Car parking is free in the middle of the street opposite. It is not in the middle of the major sights of Berlin, but the X9 bus goes past every 10mins and takes you to Zooligisher Garten station (S & U Bahnhof) in 5min, where you can travel anywhere quickly including both the 100 and 200 buses which show almost all of the major sights. The X9 bus goes to the airport in the other direction. Bus finishes at 10.40pm, but the U-Bahn keeps going until 1am and there is a station about 400m from the Hotel. Reception helpful. School groups use this hotel, so you may have trouble with noise at night, but they were great when we were there. You will love Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Accomodations in Charlottenburg Area”
Reviews.Author: KenCT
Reviews.Content: Convenient location one block south of the Mierendorff U7 stop. Twin bedded room with no ameneties or air conditioning, although the TV carries CNN. Free Internet access in the lobby. It's a stand-up station, though, and there are usually people waiting, so don't expect to do more than check your email. Adjacent supermarket makes it easy to put together your own "room service," but the absence of an ice machine requires some creativity.

Reviews.Title: “the Frog”
Reviews.Author: vancouver-jim
Reviews.Content: Its distinctive exterior colour has earned it the nickname. Small quiet dormitory sized room, therefore it had less furniture than a standard European hotel room. No shampoo, no mini-bar (fridge). European air-conditioning (open a window). Convenient location and a supermarket next door, good breakfast buffet.

HotelInfo.Name: ECONTEL HOTEL Berlin Charlottenburg
HotelInfo.Address: Sommeringstrasse 24-26, 10589 Berlin, Germany
